title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4227.3 - Eligible projects
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4227.3 - Eligible projects

State Regulations

In order to be eligible for assistance from the corporation
hereunder as an eligible project, the proposed project must satisfy the
following criteria: (a) The proposed
project must be intended to be used as a child day care center for a period of
at least 10 years. (b) The proposed
child day care center must be intended to serve the child care needs of
low-income working families, or economically distressed areas or highly
distressed communities. (c) The
applicant must demonstrate the ability to obtain all licenses and approvals for
proposed child day care center as may be deemed to be necessary or appropriate
by the department or, in the case of a child day care center located in the
city of New York, as may be deemed to be necessary or appropriate by the
commissioner of the Department of Health of the City of New York. (d) The applicant must offer at least one
quarter of the available day care placements at the proposed day care center to
the department in the locality where the proposed project will be located or
set aside those placements for persons eligible for low income day care
subsidies. Notes

4227.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
